episodes.title: Alison Rosen
episodes.summary: The ever so lovely Alison Rosen joins Iliza on this week’s episode and know that she is not fat, she’s pregnant! Alison shares with Iliza all the surprising aspects of her first pregnancy. They then move on to discuss the values of being a woman and share many a laugh along the way. Alison Rosen is totally Iliza’s New Best Friend!

episodes.title: Jake & Amir
episodes.summary: Hey truckers! Tune in for a rare DOUBLE guest pod with Jake & Amir. They join Iliza to talk about all the things that make them snobs: from t-shirts to travel. There’s also talk of the overrated Palm Springs, what it’s like to watch comedy, and how they both simply aren’t invited to Iliza’s Halloween party. It’s a hilarious episode so check it out!

episodes.title: Peri Gilpin
episodes.summary: Brace yourselves.  Not only is Peri Gilpin the most perfect guest of all time—Because not only is she stunning. Not only is she from Dallas, too. But simply, she provides a phenomenal, substantive  conversation about acting, raising children, and just simply being rad

episodes.title: Margaret Cho
episodes.summary: This week Iliza gets to sit down with comedy royalty, Margaret Cho. They start off with mutual annoyance around hugging, the more personal space the better! Then they dive into a thoughtful conversation about the struggles of being a woman in the world, and in comedy.

episodes.title: Kyle Kinane
episodes.summary: One of the most well known voices in comedy, Kyle Kinane joins Iliza to talk about his Netflix special (dropping on October 15th). They talk about Crab Daiquiris, why being angry all the time isn't sustainable, and how awkward it is to take press photos.

episodes.title: Jay Leno REVISITED
episodes.summary:
Check out this interview I had done previously with the great Jay Leno. From the original post:

"Iliza Shlesinger basks in the glow of Jay Leno as they discuss success, comedy ethics, struggles and The Tonight Show- it's all the stories comics need to hear froma man who has lived through all of it. You want to know about comedy and about yourself as a comic? Listen to this man."

Catch me at the Denver Comedy Works, 10/13 to 10/15. More dates at http://www.iliza.com

episodes.title: Kevin Nealon
episodes.summary: This week the hilarious, and talented Kevin Nealon sits down to chat with Iliza. They cover everything from comedy to punctuality. It's a must listen!!

episodes.title: Jane Leeves
episodes.summary: The funny, graceful, talented Jane Leeves (Hot in Cleveland, and Iliza's all time favorite, Frasier) stops by to talk with Iliza. It started as a respectable discussion about acting and slowly began to unravel and at one point the phrase, "Can I do my favorite Frasier quote for you?" fell out of Iliza's mouth. Enjoy!! This is a can't miss!

episodes.title: Russell Howard (LIVE from Just For Laughs 2016)
episodes.summary: Russell Howard, brilliant English comedian, actor, and television presenter, joins Iliza at Just For Laughs Festival for the first ever LIVE episode of Truth and Iliza!

episodes.title: Chris Kelly
episodes.summary: Iliza is joined by new SNL co head writer Chris Kelly. They talk life and discuss the movie he wrote and directed, Other People (out in theaters now)

episodes.title: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Iliza is joined by the hilarious and talented, Jen Kirkman. They cover the epic saga that is the American healthcare system, what it's like being on the road most of the year, and the strange compliments fans give you.
tags: Jen Kirkman: I'm Gonna Die Alone (And I Feel Fine)

episodes.title: Rolling Solo
episodes.summary: After a last minute cancellation, Iliza decides to Facebook Live a solo episode. She talks pet peeves around Hollywood men, getting sick, and busts out her interview alter ego.

episodes.title: Sarah Colonna
episodes.summary: Newly married, Sarah Colonna, joins Iliza to talk about her wedding, what it's actually like working as touring comedian, writing books, and so much more.

episodes.title: Phil Hendrie
episodes.summary: This week Iliza brings a conversation with radio legend Phil Hendrie. They talk about how he created his radio characters, and a couple even stop by, and Iliza talks about how influential Phil is to the comedy community.

episodes.title: Michele Morrow
episodes.summary: Stepping out of the comedy realm and into video games this week, Iliza sits down with Michele Morrow (Geek & Sundry, WoW). They talk about Michele's start playing video games, and how it led her to Twitch streaming. Iliza shares a story about her car, and Michele explains how she injured her shoulder.

episodes.title: Howie Mandel
episodes.summary: Iliza goes remote to Howie Mandel's offices in Van Nuys. He shares stories about his struggles with OCD and Hollywood. Iliza asks about his prank shows, and why he thinks practical jokes are so hilarious. Plus Howie shares his tips for how to be truly happy.

episodes.title: Mayim Bialik
episodes.summary: Back again with an all new episode with her new best friend, Iliza sits down with Mayim Bialik (BLOSSOM, BIG BANG THEORY). Iliza learns what it means to have a degree in Jewish studies (and what that means in terms of understanding all those rules). They also talk about Blossom in the cultural canon, and what it was like playing a young Bette Midler in BEACHES.

episodes.title: Doug Benson
episodes.summary: Iliza's back with an all new episode with podcast great, and comedian, Doug Benson. Topics include pot smoking pet peeves, participating in panel shows, and eager fanbases.

episodes.title: BEST OF Truth & Iliza - part 2
episodes.summary: Join Iliza as she presents her favorite podcast moments from guests Chamillionaire, Adam Ray, Lizz Winstead, Brad Williams and Dan Harmon

episodes.summary: Iliza and the Lucas Bros sit down and dabble in twin trickery... Then talk about race.

episodes.summary:
Iliza delves deep into improv pet peeves with UCB founder Matt Besser.

episodes.title: Coco Peru
episodes.summary: Iliza sits down with sweet, sassy and beyond regal drag queen Coco Peru and asks all the questions about drag queens straight people wanna know! Listen up people, educate yourselves! SHE IS A LEGEND!

episodes.title: Steve Simeone
episodes.summary: Iliza and living saint/comedian Steve Simeone have a very serious discussion about his epiphany regarding how horrible society treats women. Iliza defends prostitution and it gets emotional. It's a must listen for all the dudes.

episodes.title: Bert Kreischer
episodes.summary: Iliza is joined by walking party legend and storyteller extraordinaire Bert Kreischer. First Bert can't remember how old he is and the show just gets better from there. They discuss Bert's crazy life which inspired the movies VAN WILDER and AKILAH AND THE BEE. Iliza and Bert discuss tv deals, TSA, Bert's personal armory, vlogging, self control and, of course, drinking.

episodes.title: Jo Koy
episodes.summary: Iliza and comedy giant/show sell out king and Filipino ambassador, Jo Koy talk Filipino food, well, Iliza tried and ends up sounding a little racist but meant well. They talk Ube,  LA's donut scene, the irritation of people who dabble in stand up, why Jo had really poor dental luck growing up, bad food habits and then? JO TELLS US A GHOST STORY and it's the best end to a podcast ever. A Hawaiian ghost story!

episodes.title: Owen Benjamin
episodes.summary: Owen Benjamin stops by to talk to Iliza who recently had three cavities filled and has kind of a speech impediment. Topics include: marriage, not hating your wife, the first gig Owen and Iliza did together and then these two get really into our social awareness and racism- it's one of the smarter episodes we have done, and that is saying a lot!!

episodes.title: Paul Scheer
episodes.summary: Iliza and Paul Scheer sit down and Paul reveals that he isn't Jewish which catches Iliza off guard but they forge ahead discussing intimacy in a scene, selfish actors, Iliza breaks down Ronda Rousey's crushing defeat, society's hatred of women, why white people love killing everybody and they both do horrible impressions of our president and then improv their rendition of a horrific conference call- maybe the worst part about being a working anything is conference calls. It's a fun episode with a very funny and insightful man!

episodes.title: Kelly Carlin
episodes.summary: Iliza and comedy royalty, Kelly Carlin- writer of "A Carlin Home Companion" explode out of the gate with a legitimate discussion about Jung V Freud (Iliza did her homework), the secrets women won't tell eachother about their bodies, weird fetishes, Iliza's hatred for Swedish massage and yes, Iliza has Kelly read the "me likey" text to get her take because Iliza can't let anything go. Giving this episode 10/10 stars because it is a MUST LISTEN!

episodes.title: Tess Morris
episodes.summary: Writer Tess Morris of the upcoming film Man Up stops by to talk with Iliza about putting the "man" in romantic. What? No that didn't happen. BUT what did happen was they discussed their own brand of crazy in relationships, the tropes of traditional RomComs, Iliza and Tess both open up about their personal lives, we learn the phrase "crying into someone's mouth" and Iliza has Tess read a gross text from a boy aloud and they dissect as only two intelligent women can. This episode is a must listen for any girl who has ever been frustrated with themselves or at a boy. Guys, this episode is a must listen because we unlock some of our lady brain secrets and talk about different types of drunk guys. Then Iliza and Tess (most Iliza) GO OFF on some poor schmuck who had a nut allergy on an international flight.

episodes.title: Chamillionaire
episodes.summary: Iliza finds out the the music she "listened to growing up" was created by a man only three years old than her. Rapper/tech guy Chamillionaire joins Iliza as they dive deep into the transformation of rap over time, the relation of fame in comedy to fame in rap, fan expectation and authenticity. Cham shares about his interests in the tech world, Iliza explains the story of how they met (she called him 50 Cent) and then attempts to explain why women are so confusing. Iliza takes issue with Cham living in Marina Del Ray and he defends it. They discuss ugly faces, evolution of artists and Cham goes on record as promising Iliza a role as a booty girl in his next video.

episodes.title: Lizz Winstead
episodes.summary: Iliza and The Daily Show Creator, female rights activist and Nordic guilt carrier LIZZ WINSTEAD have a deep and passionate talk about abortion (girls, you need to listen. Dudes, you need to listen too), intimidation in dating, BALLOT INITIATIVES, fried food in loafular form and Iliza kind of admits the very liberal Lizz to admit that killing stupid people might be a good idea.

episodes.title: Brad Williams
episodes.summary: Iliza and long time comedy buddy Brad Williams (WARNING: THIS EPISODE IS AWESOME) discuss dwarf/midget protocol. The uniform for all garbage in Orange County, why strong women are attractive, comedic pet peeves and the confidence, as an adult to say FUCK IT "I LOVE EDM and KATY PERRY" Iliza also scolds Brad for looking at her arm pit but it turns out he was trying to see her side boob. Iliza educates Brad on a DEW CLAW and the two dissect the pros and mostly CONS of dating a comic. If you want to laugh and listen to two comics talk fast and strike with deadly precision, this is the episode for you.

episodes.title: Adam Ray
episodes.summary:
Iliza sits with long time friend and fellow podcaster/Jew/TBS host to dig into why Iliza hates Sprint, why Adam hates the nerdy annoying loser at a Seattle area gym, Adam's dedication to acting from the class room to his odd jobs and everything in between. The two get into why their mom's mean well but drive them crazy with nothing that matters- the two talk about idiots from their schools and Iliza explains her passion for ranting online then shares her secret way to text without making your thumb hurt. It's a fast paced episode that probably covers most of the things that annoy you, so buckle up. Sidenote? After they stopped recording, Iliza, Brian and Adam had a serious talk about 911, lying, sociopaths, heartbreak and why the women on The View are horrible.

episodes.title: Alonzo Bodden
episodes.summary:
Iliza sits down with fellow Last Comic Standing Winner, Alonzo Bodden to discuss, yes of course race. They talk soul food, secret black menus, audience perception, racism in Valencia, the archetypes of annoying people at parties and why we should allow stupid people to off themselves. Your dad loves Alonzo.
This episode is great for anyone who has ever silently raged against any system! If you've got a car and a license, put 'em both to work for you and start earning serious, life-changing money today. Sign up to drive with Uber. Visit http://www.DriveWithUber.com

episodes.title: Adam Carolla
episodes.summary:
Iliza sits down with Guinness record holder most podcast downloads, Adam Carolla- the two friends who seemingly share a brain, talk about the perception of success and how it just makes you look gross when you hate rich people. Adam and Iliza bond over the fact that idiots run the world and love to come from a place of "NO" before granting you access to anything you deserve. Adam shares an enlightening story about putting a jaded Latino chick in place at the Arclight parking lot, Iliza name checks the idiot pharmacist who wouldn't give her her birth control because he was positive it was prescribed to a man with the exact same last name. Adam explains that genuine rage surpasses gender and race, and in some cases, a verbal smack is what most people need. The two discuss privilege and spoiled kids, working hard and the two of them GO OFF on The View. This episode is great for anyone who has ever silently raged against any system!

episodes.title: Jeff Miller of Thrillist
episodes.summary:
Iliza sits down with Thrillist senior editor Jeff Miller and it gets... amazing. This episode is all about food- subjects include how repulsive Iliza finds steak toppers, the debate over the essential burger ingredients, men's obsession with grilling, why GrubHub insists on only showing us Indian restaurants and why Indian restaurants are so weird about their Naan. They also discuss the simplicity of some foods like steak, food nostalgia, Jeff's mom carrying ranch dressing everywhere, why Brioche can suck it, Iliza's issues with LA Tacos and her uneducated aversion to eating goat, foie gras or lamb... We also find out foie gras is doled out in "lobes" and then Iliza has Jeff smell her earring.  Frozen yogurt, dessert martinis, disdain for avocados- these two basically cover everything you have ever hafted, loved or thought about food.
If you've got a car and a license, put 'em both to work for you and start earning serious, life-changing money today. Sign up to drive with Uber. Visit http://www.DriveWithUber.com

episodes.title: Jodi Miller
episodes.summary:
TRUCKERS! Listen to this episode if you need to stay awake. Iliza talks with long time comedy best friend, comedian, writer and PRETTY FUNNY (blaaah) woman, JODI MILLER. Jodi shares with Iliza some horrible pick up lines, online dating experiences- including being forced to go on a date with a guy AND his girlfriend... Iliza then gets a chance to share with her audience a hateful text message she wrote on Jodi's behalf to a woman Iliza had never even met- it's so venomous and angry, yet Iliza says it was one of easiest and most cathartic things she has ever done.
If you want to know what to say and not say to a woman, then guys, you need to listen to this. The girls talk horrible British accents, using exclamation points in sex talk and horrific dick pics. THIS IS ONE OF THE FUNNIEST EPISODES OF A PODCAST EVER!

episodes.title: Megan Koester
episodes.summary:
Beyond excited with finding her article about the truths of living in Los Angeles, Iliza sits down with writer/comedian Megan Koester to kvetch about living in LA while simultaneously defending LA, the reality of being excluded from parties but also looking down on other people, why everything in LA is a distraction for why you aren't famous and why Megan got kicked off a red carpet for asking too many questions about jerking off and the importance of owning your shininess. This girl is funny and Iliza also bought her an iced coffee... She also hurt her ankle but Iliza wasn't buying it.

episodes.title: Steve Weissman
episodes.summary:
Iliza and friend/ESPN sports anchor/good looking nice Jewish boy Steve Weissman kick off the pod with Steve explaining why he wouldn't take off his hat in a steak house. They explore every peeve from women's tennis screams to catch phrases like "Boom goes the dynamite"- Steve then challenges Iliza's sports knowledge which turns out to be pretty impressive, depending on how well informed you are. They talk hair, instagram pet peeves and the art of accepting a compliment.
If you've got a car and a license, put 'em both to work for you and start earning serious, life-changing money today. Sign up to drive with Uber. Visit http://www.DriveWithUber.com

episodes.title: Dr. Drew Pinsky
episodes.summary: Iliza and Dr. Drew discuss social theories about why women are so horrible to each other, why men are so horrible to women and Dr. Drew even has some challenging questions for Iliza about her own dating life. They take a look at a weird spot growing on the back of Iliza's leg and Dr. Drew shares with us some secret pet peeves of a celebrity doctor.

episodes.title: Taylor Dayne
episodes.summary:
This week, Iliza Shlesinger sits down with the legendary singer of Iliza's favorite song EVER "Tell it To My Heart" Taylor Dayne to talk about their mutual love of freestyle music and mutual hate of bad reviews, racism, tough Jews and so much more... Plus, Iliza and Taylor dream up the next big iPhone app, sort of. The pod ends with a special heart stopping moment for Iliza.
Make sure to update your iTunes subscription to the NEW podcast feed at http://bit.ly/Iliza today!

episodes.title: Elayne Boosler
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger sits down with comedic icon ELAYNE BOOSLER to discuss life as a comic, annoying things comics deal with, annoying things female comics deal with, and the overall stupidity of morning radio hosts.  They also trade songs they sing to their animals and it is THE MOST AMAZING PIECE OF MUSIC EVER PRODUCED!

episodes.title: Greg Longstreet
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and publicist to the stars (formerly Iliza's publicist now turned best friend) Greg Longstreet discuss drunken nights, the annoyance of people trying to own a life narrative that isn't theirs, and death... Like, real death.

episodes.title: Reggie Watts
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and musician, comedian and all around deep thinker and fun hair haver Reggie Watts dive deep into what starts as a seemingly superficial discussion about being anti-Starbucks but transforms into so much more. Topics ranges from food for the poor, social responsibility, fake professions, misconceptions about perceived societal labels to so so much more. WARNING: Lots of intelligence and fun voices being thrown around.

episodes.title: Steve Agee
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and New Girl's Steve Agee talk 90s pet peeves and get into AIM, chat room disruption, and horoscopes, especially the annoying part about identifying with a sign. Iliza espouses her thoughts on having blues eyes and being superior while shitting on lame people with brown eyes. Then Steve and Iliza crap on Cuddle Parties

episodes.title: Carnie Wilson
episodes.summary:
This episode is a MUST LISTEN because Iliza Shlesinger calls American Wilson Phillips legend Carnie Wilson a slut. Then it turns out Carnie records all of her farts - so the girls get into that!
Carnie and Iliza act through therapeutic exercises in telling people how to be quiet in a nicer way. Iliza asks Carnie if she could date a man who doesn't like lobster and Carnie promises to make Iliza mac and Cheese.

episodes.title: Jamie Clayton
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and Sense8 actress Jamie Clayton dive into topics ranging from silencing families on airplanes (shocker, Iliza brings up airplanes again) and being embarrassed about carrying an Aldo bag. They talk about being pretty, societies labels and an interesting surprise is revealed to the audience about Jamie! But it's her message to share! So listen to hear it!

episodes.title: Ben Gleib
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and long time BFF Ben Gleib (Host of Idiotest on GSN) discuss annoying dates, delve deep into heartfelt debates about the their life choices, and take a call from Ben's parents. Ben also does a spot-on impression of famed manager Barry Katz and ends the show by live Periscoping... something?

episodes.title: Chris Porter
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and comedian Chris Porter really get into it - talkin' 'bout bad sex with young girls, annoying dating profiles, turning down sex from thick-gummed women, the pitfalls of bad podcasts, bringing a date to Hooters, and Iliza (again) asks the question "Why don't we kill more dumb people?"

episodes.title: John Heffron
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and fellow Last Comic Standing winner, comedian John Heffron, discuss everything from hotel rituals and cold remedies to personal stories about hecklers who turn out to be Sugar Ray Leonard. They talk comedy strategy and pet peeves about credits and other things that make a comics world go round and round!

episodes.title: Jonathan Kite
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and 2 Broke Girls' Jonathan Kite ate Japanese snacks and squirted goo all over, Jonathan complimented Blanche quite a bit, but who wouldn't? Iliza talked about that gross crayfish tower that looked like roaches and whether or not we would be cool with eating bugs. And Jonathan, although famous for his dead-on impressions, doesn't grace us with them till the end. It was like having Mark Wahlberg AND Vince Vaughn on the pod!

episodes.title: Kelly Oxford
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and famed writer, blogger and Tweeter Kelly "I'll go to a Russian doctor, fuck it" Oxford discuss juicing, American healthcare and its shortcomings, why Coachella is bull crap, why Palm Springs sucks, why if you poop on an airplane you're an idiot and then Kelly drags Iliza through all the pop culture she avoids and it is... So sinfully delicious - The Bachelor, Real Housewives, Kardashians - it was like taking a bath in forbidden garbage!

episodes.title: Dave Coulier
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and Dave Coulier sit down and talk, at length, about hand farts, hand fart impersonations, under the table dessert blow jobs, guys' weekends and how Dave isn't Candian. Also, Iliza and Dave share a hug and a touching moment 25 years in the making.

episodes.title: Megan Rosati
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and 52 Ways to Break Up creator Megan Rosati delve deep into the world of vomiting, racism, bad fast food, overpriced LA tacos, fancy upbringings and really explore the question of what is appropriate drunk behavior. Then they talk more about vomiting.

episodes.title: Jessie Rosen
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and writer/blogger extraordinaire Jessie Rosen discuss snoring, inner anger and Jessie's "the moment" (a special minute created for her to freak out as a child... What?). Jessie loves fashion and Iliza obviously hates it. They also talk about writing hurtful emails, misophonia, how Papersource stays in business and why LA girls are hotter than NY girls.

episodes.title: Bryan Callen & Brendan Schaub
episodes.summary: IT'S A MANFEST! The Fighter and The Kid's Bryan Callen and Brendan Schaub stop by to talk about HOTEL FIGHTS IN YOUR TIGHTY WHITIES, GENTLE PUSHING, love making laziness, and selfishness at a family picnic. It doesn't get manlier than this show, and these guys just made it better!

episodes.title: Oliver Trevena
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and Young Hollywood host Oliver Trevena talk double condoms, a new found dislike for Trader Joe's, hookers' rights, rejection based on looks, and Iliza does her best to curb her fascination with Oliver's accent. Also - RAPEY IN THE NIGHT- find out what that's about as Oliver tries to hold back his sexual aggressions during REM sleep.

episodes.title: Mary Lynn Rajskub
episodes.summary: 24's Mary Lynn Rajskub and Iliza Shlesinger dig deep into Japanese snacks and testing their ASMR triggers and responses. They get into a heated argument about decency and that Nationwide commercial where the kid dies. All of this happens while under attack from maybe the BIGGEST fly ever - ew, it was so fat, Iliza thought it was a small bird.

episodes.title: Nick Youssef
episodes.summary: Iliza and long time comedy buddy Nick Youssef passionately debate the rights of cyclists in heavily trafficked areas, the rage that ensues when people don't uphold their end of social contracts (ie: saying THANK YOU when you hold a door open), music festivals, what makes a hipster and plenty of other spirited and healthy differences of opinion. Iliza also tries to bring up Shark Week, per usual, but is denied.

episodes.title: Cheri Oteri
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger turns into a drooling 18-year-old super fan when she has Saturday Night Live alum CHERI OTERI on the pod! They talk about the gay glory that was Lance Bass' wedding and how Iliza approached Cheri and lured her to the show. They also talk about Cheri's famous characters, where the characters' pain comes from, and how hard it is to be yourself onstage. It's a fun romp in the world of character comedy and all the highs and lows that come with it! SIMMAH DAHN NAH!!!

episodes.title: Julieanne Smolinski
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger and TV writer/NY Magazine contributor Julieanne Smolinski dig right into pet peeves with DMing, why girls pretend to drink alone, bad break up lines and what it's like when you're mom says you look like Anne Frank. Julianne is funny and really really really smart so...Yeah, probably much smarter than you.... You're gonna wanna turn this one up.

episodes.title: Jay Leno
episodes.summary: Iliza Shlesinger basks in the glow of Jay Leno as they discuss success, comedy ethics, struggles and The Tonight Show- it's all the stories comics need to hear froma man who has lived through all of it. You want to know about comedy and about yourself as a comic? Listen to this man.

episodes.title: Marc Summers
episodes.summary: Iliza sits down with childhood memory staple Marc Summers of Double Dare to discuss TV, hosting, Hawaiian DMVs and Marc's lonely single girl addiction to fried chicken and Coca Cola!

episodes.title: Neal Brennan
episodes.summary: Iliza and Neal Brennan discuss types of dumb girls, the environment, bad parties and why poor people are bad at everything. They also talk comedy pet peeves like the psychology of a heckler and then Iliza takes ages to make time at the end to rant about a bad soup experience at Mendocino Farms last night.

episodes.title: David Koechner
episodes.summary: PLEASE WELCOME THE LOVELY AND TAL-ENT-ED BLAH BLAH BLAH- Iliza and Anchorman's David Koechner discuss pet peeves, families and fame. It's a real love/hate fest!

episodes.title: Diablo Cody
episodes.summary: Iliza and Oscar Winner/Cool Mom Brooke "Diablo Cody" discuss Las Vegas, "normative gender roles" and why self righteous parents are the worst.

episodes.title: Brendon Small
episodes.summary: THE MOST METAL EPISODE EVER- Iliza talks with comedian/writer/musician and Adult Swim Metalocalypse creator  Brendon Small about entitlement, bad table manners, Iliza's lizard eye, and what happens when you run into Eddie Van Halen and he touches you in a way that makes you want to bludgeon him with a stool. METAL!

episodes.title: John Ratzenberger
episodes.summary: Iliza talks with Pixar voice GOD and Cheers Alum John Ratzenberger about WHAT THE HELL IS WRONG WITH THESE KIDS TODAY!

episodes.title: Melissa Stetten
episodes.summary: Iliza sits down with the Pistol Shrimps' star player, REAL model and REAL writer Melissa Stetten to talk about psycho bitches, why Iliza feels rejected by Hollywood women's basketball, what drives women to be crazy, crack cocaine and Iliza analyses Melissa's runway model walk.

episodes.title: Carrie Keagan
episodes.summary: TV super host and all around hot chick Carrie Keagan stops by to rant with Iliza on why being a girl can be gross and difficult. The girls also talk about that one friend we all have who gets scary when they're drunk, cat rape and why it's okay for men to look at your boobs. It's a very intense episode so if you don't want to know the truth about being a girl, if you can't handle it, don't listen, punk.

episodes.title: Mark Ellis
episodes.summary: Iliza and Schmoes Know co creator/Iliza's 3rd best friend Mark Ellis talk everything from best moments in a horror movie, child hood pet peeves, Jolt Cola, mom dates and genuinely enjoy basking in the warm glow of each other's comedic presence.

episodes.title: Lance Bass
episodes.summary: Iliza sports the MOMest of haircuts while yapping with her favorite boy band member turned BEST FRIEND Lance Bass. These two really get after it coming down on pedestrians, homeless people making traffic, bad service (Lance lost it at The W), throwing shad within your own stereotype, GAY PEOPLE, horrible contractors and Iliza's fantasy about IF she were a serial killer how she would fantasize about strangling the Angie's List woman's meaty neck. Iliza offends, Lance remains composed, Southern and charming!

episodes.title: Elan Gale
episodes.summary: Iliza and Elan talk about platonic baths, Elan's body, inadvertent airplane publicity stunts with a BITCH NAMED DIANE, crazy exes, customer service mishaps with overpriced pretentious soap and then they make Blanche ride a Zebra- this episode is one of Iliza's favorites because she got some good complaining in.

episodes.title: Kevin Christy
episodes.summary: Kevin and Iliza talk about the trust it takes to not get punched in the face, comedians' obligations to annoying people on Twitter, Kevin's dog utopia, why comics need to chill out and pretty much everything in between. This episode gets very honest.

episodes.title: Bob Saget
episodes.summary: It's a grab bag of topics on this episode as Iliza and Bob Saget effortlessly jump from topic to topic, exploring their feelings on why people who don't know you is a pain, people who do you know is a pain, why going out and dealing with a door guy is a pain, frying body parts, adults at Disney Land, illicit sex, AND WHY PEOPLE ARE MAKING TRAFFIC ON PURPOSE! DIE BIKE RIDERS!

episodes.title: Cody Heller
episodes.summary: Co-creator of Hulu's "Deadbeat" Cody Heller drops by the show to talk with Iliza about her "starring role" in the pilot, scheduling nightmares, and the high of meeting someone new.

episodes.title: Samantha Ronson
episodes.summary: Iliza and DJ Samantha Ronson talk music, what it means to be a legit DJ and what happens when your dog goes to animal court for eating another dog. The girls also discus shame spirals, celebrity tweet retaliation, racism and, at the end, Iliza says "explosive diarrhea" to Samantha and she gets super grossed out.

episodes.title: Boyd Vico and Brad Stevens
episodes.summary: Comedy showrunners and writers Boyd Vico and Brad Stevens drop by to talk with Iliza about the horrors of creating a show in Hollywood, the ineptitude of Shark Tank contestants, and the harrowing tale...of SWAMP WITCH!

episodes.title: Rawson Marshall Thurber
episodes.summary: Writer and director Rawson Marshall Thurber ("Dodgeball," "We're The Millers") drops by the show to grouse with Iliza about littering, fake nerds, and weird film pitches.

episodes.title: Kevin Pereira
episodes.summary: Host, podcaster, online entrepreneur, and TV personality Kevin Pereira drops by the show to chat with Iliza about traumatic dog stories, weird MySpace contests, and, shudder, going gluten free.

episodes.title: Daniel Musto and Orly Shani
episodes.summary: Celebrity stylist Daniel Musto and fashion designer/host of The Fabulist Orly Shani join Iliza to share stories about Uber ratings, lingerie anxiety, and annoying "celebrity" DJs.

episodes.title: Jim Jefferies
episodes.summary: Iliza welcomes comedian, actor, and writer Jim Jefferies to talk about rude audiences, vulgar gestures, and potty training.

episodes.title: Joe Rogan
episodes.summary: On her first episode, Iliza welcomes comedian, actor, writer, and UFC commentator Joe Rogan to talk about polyamorous relationships, Mormon planets, and beauty pageants.
